conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the sled and use the conditions for equilibrium.
The sled is moving at a constant speed, so the net force in both the horizontal and vertical directions must be zero.
Identify the forces acting on the sled: force applied by the adult, weight of the child and sled, normal force, and frictional force.
Resolve the force F into its horizontal component: F cos θ = 80 N.
Resolve the force F into its vertical component: F sin θ = 60 N.
Determine the total weight of the child and sled: (m_child + m_sled) g = 400 N.
Determine the normal force N: N = 400 N - 60 N = 340 N.
Determine the frictional force f: f = F cos θ = 80 N.
Verify the vertical forces: N = 400 N - 60 N = 340 N.
The magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground is the normal force, N = 340 N.
